intro: Conyza mollis, commonly known as downy conyza, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, often covered in fine, soft hairs that give it a downy appearance. Conyza mollis is typically found in open, disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
